name: Agnus
notes: High alpha variety with relatively large beta content, this hop is descended from Sladek. Comparable to Magnum, Taurus, Columbus, Target.

name: Ahtanum
notes: Distinctive aroma like Cascade.

name: Amarillo
notes: A recent aroma variety, this citrusy American hop is also used for its smooth bittering properties due to its low cohumulone levels.

name: Apollo
notes: Clean bittering and stores great. When used for aroma, lends strong grapefruit and hoppy notes.

name: Bor
notes: This hop is now primarily being substituted with Premiant, which is more stable with respect to alpha content and yield.

name: Bramling
notes: Distinctive and pleasant aroma. Fruity, black currant, and lemon notes.

name: Bravo
notes: Bittering hop with fruity and floral aroma.

name: Brewers Gold
notes: Complex bittering hop w/ sharp bittering quality. Imparts fruity/spicy aroma with black currant notes. Adds a distinctive European element to beers. Good with Tettnang and Hallertau.

name: Bullion
notes: Intense, black currant aroma, spicy and pungent.

name: Cascade
notes: Pleasant, floral, spicy, and citrus-like.

name: Centennial
notes: Medium with floral and citrus tones.

name: Challenger
notes: Mild to Moderate but quite spicy. Typically used for aroma.

name: Chelan
notes: Bittering hop with a lot of beta acid.

name: Chinook
notes: Medium strength, spicy, piney aroma. Used in IPAs, stouts, porters, pale ales, and lagers for bittering.

name: Citra
notes: Released in 2007 as a dual-purpose variety, this hop does well as a bittering hop due to low cohumulone content, and high alpha acids. When used for aroma, it lends tropical fruit and citrus characteristics.
substitutes: Probably none, but a citrusy hop can make an approximation.

name: Cluster
notes: Dual-purpose with floral aroma.

name: Columbus/Tomahawk/Zeus
notes: Super high alpha varieties.

name: Crystal
notes: Mild, spicy, floral aroma. Developed from Hallertau, with some Cascade and such.

name: El Dorado
notes: Emerged in 2011. Described as having a watermelon candy, pear, and passion fruit flavor.

name: First Gold
notes: First commercial dwarf hop designed for aroma consideration in England.

name: Fuggles
notes: Mild and pleasant, spicy, soft, woody.
substitutes: Willamette, East Kent Goldings, Styrian Goldings, Tettnang

name: Galena
notes: Balanced bittering and nice aroma. Used with English and American ales.

name: Glacier
notes: Dual-purpose, well balanced with pleasant aroma, this is used in stouts, porters, bitters, ESBs, and English-style pale ales.

name: Golding
notes: A.K.A Yakima Golding. This is an American version of traditional English aroma varieties.

name: Green Bullet
notes: Has a raisiny character.

name: Hallertau
notes: Mild, pleasant and slightly flowery.

name: Harmonie
notes: Introduced in 2004, this variety is mainly being used for aroma. This variety has a high ratio of beta to alpha (1:1), and has a bit more alpha acid than Sladek.

name: Hersbrucker
notes: Mild to moderate aroma.

name: Kent Goldings
notes: Gentle, fragrant and slightly spicy.

name: Liberty
notes: Mild and pleasant, quite fine. Acts like a true noble variety.

name: Lublin (Lubelski)
notes: Finishing hop usually, but may be used throughout the boil.

name: Magnum
notes: Clean German flavor and aroma profile.

name: Marynka
notes: All-purpose, but generally used for bittering.

name: Millennium
notes: Clean bittering and stores well. When used for aroma, lends strong grapefruit and hoppy notes.

name: Mount Hood
notes: Mild, pleasant, clean, light, and delicate.

name: Northern Brewer
notes: Medium-strong, woody with evergreen and mint overtones.

name: Nugget
notes: Mild aroma, low cohumulone for smooth bitterness.

name: Palisade
notes: Bred as an aroma hop with perfume-like qualities. Also used for smooth bittering potential in moderate quantities.

name: Perle
notes: Pleasant, slightly spicy

name: Phoenix
notes: Bittering or aroma hop for English ales.

name: Premiant
notes: Characterized by high alpha content and yield, Premiant was registered in 1996 and has been bred mostly out of Saaz. Tends to have a fine, neutral bitterness due to low cohumulone content. It is usually used as a flavor addition, and compares with Sladek.

name: Pride of Ringwood
notes: Quite pronounced but not unpleasant, citrus-like.

name: Progress
notes: Similar to Fuggles, has a mild spicy or woody character, but slightly sweeter and with softer bitterness.

name: Rubin
notes: This is a bittering hop descended from European aroma hops and Saaz. It has a fine bitterness with a longer finish than Saaz.

name: Saaz (Czech Republic)
notes: Very mild with pleasant hoppy notes.

name: Saaz (USA)
notes: Very mild and pleasant, spicy and fragrant

name: Simcoe
notes: Dual-purpose hop. Has a piney aroma suited to American ales.

name: Sladek
notes: Characterized by a high ratio of beta acids and high yield. This variety was introduced in 1994, and was bred from Saaz. It is primarily used in flavor additions of lager beers, often with Saaz being the finishing hop. Some breweries also use it as the finishing hop for non-premium beers.

name: Sorachi Ace
notes: Has a decidedly lemon-like aroma and taste. Usually used for bittering.

name: Spalt
notes: Classic noble hop. Mild, spicy aroma. Spalt Select is a hardier variety often labeled as Spalt.

name: Sterling
notes: An aroma variety with smooth bitterness, and noble hop aroma. The aroma is herbal and spicy with some floral and citrus notes. Used primarily in Pilsners and Lagers as a Saaz substitute.

name: Styrian Goldings
notes: Delicate, slightly spicy, soft and floral. Actually a derivative of Fuggles, not Goldings.

name: Summit
notes: Bittering variety with earthy aroma and slight citrus notes.

name: Super Galena
notes: Very similar to Galena in aroma and bitterness.

name: Target
notes: Pleasant English hop aroma, quite intense. Admiral has a less harsh bitterness.

name: Tettnang
notes: Very spicy, mild, floral, very aromatic. Noble hop.

name: Tillicum
notes: Pleasant, slightly spicy

name: Tradition
notes: A.K.A Hallertauer Tradition. Similar flavor to Hallertauer, with improved disease resistance.

name: Vanguard
notes: Derived from Hallertau. Flavor is like an herbal Hallertau or slightly buttery Tettnang.

name: Warrior
notes: Mild aroma, clean an neutral bittering.

name: Willamette
notes: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy, aromatic.

name: Willamette
notes: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy, aromatic.

name: Northern Brewer
notes: Medium-strong, woody with evergreen and mint overtones.

name: Northern Brewer
notes: Medium-strong, woody with evergreen and mint overtones.

name: Northern Brewer
notes: Medium-strong, woody with evergreen and mint overtones.

notes: Gentle, fragrant and slightly spicy.

notes: Mild, pleasant and slightly flowery.
